instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message:
I Have:
PPBUS_G3H
PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS
PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS
PPDCIN_G3H
PP3V42_G3H
PPVRTC_G3H

I don't have:
5V Rails
Mouse Light

Logic Board looks good, don't have any water damage or something like that.

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message:
You will not get a mouse light because it does not turn on. If it is not turning on, it cannot power a USB device. The purpose of plugging in a mouse is to see if the machine can POST, which can only happen once it has turned on. 

Do you have PP5V_S5 or PP3V3_S5?

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message:
[USER="1"]larossmann[/USER], Thank you for the answer.
I don't get both: PP5V_S5 and PP3V3_S5

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message: Is SMC_PM_G2_EN present? If it is present, is it 3.3v, 0v, or jumping up and down between 0v and 3.3v?

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message: I have 3.3v on SMC_PM_G2_EN

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message: Well this is pointing to bad TPS51125. SMC_PM_G2_EN tells PP5V_S5 to turn on. If PP5V_S5 is not shorted to ground[I](which indicates no problem after U7200)[/I] and SMC_PM_G2_EN is present[I](indicating no problem before U7200)[/I] then I imagine your problem is U7200. Is there a short to ground on PP5V_S5? If there is no short to ground on these lines something is going on in U7200 area. Inspect it closely before replacing the chip to see if there are hints of anything else being the problem, and if there are none, just replace U7200.

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message: U mean: U7201

threads.title: 820-2936-b - no pp5v
threads.message: Sure, go ahead and replace U7201.....
